lead_paragraph: State lawmakers voted to extend $48.7 million in emergency aid to keep Detroit’s school district open for the rest of the academic year.

headline.print_headline: Michigan: Detroit Schools Will Get Emergency Aid
headline.main: Michigan: Detroit Schools Will Get Emergency Aid

snippet: State lawmakers voted to extend $48.7 million in emergency aid to keep Detroit’s school district open for the rest of the academic year.
abstract: Michigan Legislature approves $48.7 million emergency aid bill to keep schools in Detroit open through current academic year; Gov Rick Snyder has said he will sign legislation.
